intro: Kajewskiella polyantha, commonly known as the Chinese bellflower, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to China. It features showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to blue and violet, depending on the variety. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and has hairy, lance-shaped leaves. It thrives in well-drained soil and partial to full sunlight, making it a popular choice for garden cultivation. The flowers bloom in late spring to early summer, adding a vibrant touch to gardens and landscapes.
